name: groundwork
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
work that is done as a preparation for work that will be done later: lay the groundwork for The committee will meet today to lay the groundwork for inter-party talks next month. The groundwork for the book stalled soon after it began.
architecture
  specialized (also groundworks [ plural ]) the first part of building work, in which existing buildings, trees, etc. are removed and the surface of the ground is prepared: Costing 200 million pounds, groundwork began on the site in February. Some building projects never get beyond foundation stage because the groundworks swallow the entire budget.
More examplesFewer examplesThe groundwork put in by Sarah and her team proved crucial.It's that kind of groundwork that has helped the organization accomplish what it has.The company's business is laying groundwork on construction sites.The planned groundworks are aimed at improving drainage.
